p: In the present study, an analytic method based on the FT-IR technology for the three main bio-macromolecules, including lipid, carbohydrate, and protein, will be constructed to analyze the cellular composition of the oleaginous protist Aurantiochytrium sp. This method will be applied in strain screening, medium optimization and fermentation of Aurantiochytrium sp. The feasibility and reliability of the FT-IR method and the potentials of Aurantiochytrium sp. strains for lipid and carbohydrate productions will be evaluated, which accelerates the research development of Aurantiochytrium sp., and improves its applications in medical, food and feed industries.
